results.title: Notes on a harpsichord
results.creator_credit: John Read, David Cheshire and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Craftsman”.
Follows a harpsichord from its construction to a concert performance. Philip Ledger, who is Musical Director of the Aldeburgh Festival and is one of Britain’s finest continuo players, describes the basic features of the harpsichord, and introduces the man who maintains and tunes his own harpsichord for concert performance - Malcolm Russell.

results.title: Notes for a film about Donna and Gail
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs, ONF | NFB and Don Owen
results.brief_description: The story of two young women who go to the city to work in a dress factory, and who share a room to ease their expenses and their loneliness. The film shows the currents that brought them together and the facets of their natures that first made them seem compatible but eventually drove them apart. Their story reflects, to a degree, the situation of anyone who has ever shared the life of another.

results.title: Not without foundation
results.creator_credit: Country Roads Board and Andrew Sinclair
results.brief_description: Describes the investigation, design and construction of the piled foundations of the elevated structure of the West Gate Freeway, South Melbourne Section, with special emphasis on the new methods developed particularly for the rock upon which the West Gate Freeway structures will be founded, and which can be applied to any type of rock.

results.title: Not wanted: pollution
results.brief_description: The forest industry is the main export industry in Sweden, but it is also the main polluter of the water courses in the country. In 1969 Sweden made new stringent environmental protection laws, and in 1970 the pulp industry began pollution control projects. Investment requirements in the pollution control sector are considerable and in order to obtain the best possible basis for these investments, a research project - The Forest Industries’ Water and Air Pollution Research Laboratory - was started. Some examples of pollution control measures in the pulp industry are shown.

results.title: Not wanted on voyage
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson, Australian National Film Board and Hugh Alexander
results.brief_description: An account of the work being done by the Commonwealth Plant Quarantine officers to prevent the introduction of dangerous insect pests and plant diseases into this country from overseas. In addition to checking cargoes on arrival at Australian ports, quarantine officers extend their vigilance to overseas loading points in their efforts to keep Australia free of diseases prevalent in other countries.

results.title: Not so much a desert, more a way of life
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Up a gum tree”.
Much of the surface of Australia is described as desert. But is this a true description? Wherever he looks, David Bellamy finds life among the sand and rocks.

results.title: Not really morning people
results.creator_credit: Renee Rutgrink and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Can’t handle Mondays? Don’t think you can get out of bed tomorrow? Perhaps you’re not really a morning person. A cheeky tour into our morning journeys guided by a couple of observant experts we never really notice.
